attributes.action: Delay/cancel all university exams and assignment deadlines until further notice
attributes.additional_details: University students will not achieve their full potential if current ways of studying continue. Face to face teaching is a necessity for guidance and reassurance through a normal academic year, and yet it is now becoming harder to complete what is expected through such global pandemic. As GCSE’s and A Levels are already cancelled, this should be the same for 1st and 2nd year university students for both academic and psychological reasoning.
attributes.background: Online learning is not sufficient enough for university students. All exams, assignments and deadlines should be cancelled for 1st and 2nd year students, with the possibility of moving the 2019/2020 academic end of year deadlines to September/October 2020.

rejection.details:
Decisions about university assessments and exams are a matter for individual universities, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
